data.description:
This is Officer Juan Galazzo. Last year, he was recognized for his quick actions, compassion and professionalism that prevented a juvenile from ending her own life. 

Everyday, there are officers just like him who help prevent those wanting to end their lives from doing so. Suicide is the third leading cause of death for youth between the ages of 10 and 24, and results in approximately 4,600 lives lost each year. 

In honor of #SuicidePreventionWeek and #NationalSuicidePreventionMonth, reach out for help if you’re depressed and need someone to talk to. It’s ok not to be ok. 

If you’re noticing signs of depression in a friend or loved one, reach out to them. Have those difficult conversations. The more we talk about it the more we end the stigma surrounding suicide. 

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline '1-800-273-TALK (8255)' 24/7. Free. Confidential. 

Crisis Text Line Text “BAY” to 741741 to connect to a trained counselor for free. Confidential. 24/7.

Trans Lifeline 1-877-565-8860 24/7. Free. Confidential. 

The Trevor Project 1-866-488-7386 24/7. Free. Confidential. 

#SuicideAwareness
